meanings.sent1: She divided the cake into ninths to share it equally among her friends.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for adding two ninths of a cup of sugar to the mixture.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that if you eat a ninth of a cookie every hour, it will last all day!
meanings.sent4: His excitement was like cutting a pie into ninths and getting the biggest slice.
meanings.sent5: The garden was divided into ninths, each section blooming with different flowers.

meanings.definition: The interval between one note and another note eight notes away from it.
meanings.sent1: The musician played a beautiful melody with a perfect ninths interval between the notes.
meanings.sent2: In music theory, a ninths interval creates a harmonious sound when played together.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed in a strange ninths pitch, surprising everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, filling the air with a joyful ninths harmony.
meanings.sent5: The wind chimes outside created a soothing ninths melody on a breezy afternoon.

meanings.definition: The ninth member of a sequence.
meanings.sent1: In the alphabet, 'i' is the ninths letter following 'a'.
meanings.sent2: The runner crossed the finish line as the ninths participant in the race.
meanings.sent3: The ninths student to arrive in class had to sit in the last row.
meanings.sent4: She always picked the ninths item on the menu, making it her lucky choice.
meanings.sent5: The detective identified the suspect as the ninths person in the lineup.
